intro: Cyathodes pendulosa, commonly known as the hanging cyathodes, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its pendulous, clustered inflorescences called cyathodes, which are modified to resemble flowers. These structures consist of a cup-like receptacle surrounded by specialized bracts and reduced flowers. Cyathodes pendulosa typically grows as a shrub or small tree, and it thrives in tropical and subtropical environments.
